snippet: A federal judge in St. Louis ordered Thursday that police forces in the region limit their use of tear gas when responding to peaceful protests.
abstract: Federal Judge Carol E Jackson orders police in St Louis region to limit their use of tear gas when responding to peaceful demonstrators who have gathered daily to protest issues surrounding death of Michael Brown; temporary restraining order addresses protesters' claims that police had violated their constitutional rights by using unnecessary force.
lead_paragraph: A federal judge in St. Louis ordered Thursday that police forces in the region limit their use of tear gas when responding to peaceful protests.

headline.main: Judge in St. Louis Orders Limits on Police Tear Gas Use
headline.print_headline: Judge Orders Limits on Police Tear Gas Use
